lead_paragraph: The moves by the two Scandinavian countries represented another step in the erosion of the ideal of borderless travel across most of the European Union.

byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin.

snippet: The moves by the two Scandinavian countries represented another step in the erosion of the ideal of borderless travel across most of the European Union.

headline.main: Sweden and Denmark Add Border Checks to Stem Flow of Migrants
headline.print_headline: Sweden and Denmark Tighten Border Controls to Stem Flow of Migrants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

abstract: Ongoing flow of migrants into northern Europe prompts Sweden and Denmark, once among region's more welcoming countries, to tighten borders; measures responding to economic concerns, practical difficulties of processing refugees and populist anti-immigrant political pressure, further imperil goal of frictionless intercontinental travel.
